comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/535.10 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/17.0.947.0 Safari/535.10

Steps to reproduce:

1- Select daily or weekly view
2- Select a start time and keep the mouse button pushed
3- Go down to the end time and release the button
4- Click outside the event


Actual results:

The event appears and the text pointer is on the title. Typing something will edit the title. However, clicking outside the event doesn't release, modify or create the event. You have to push "enter" or select time for a new event.


Expected results:

When clicking outside the freshly yet-to-be-created event, this should create and apply the new event with the desired title.
comments.author: alexandre.f.demers@gmail.com
